DOC.brief_summary: This study examine effect antidepressant medication placebo brain function normal subject . In study , recording brain electrical activity use detect monitor response treatment venlafaxine IR ( Effexor ) , drug use treatment depression . The intent study test specific hypotheses regard : 1. long-term brain effect single course antidepressant treatment 2. pharmaco-conditioning effect underlie antidepressant tolerance/sensitization 3. brain functional response initial versus subsequent antidepressant trial normal healthy subject .
DOC.brief_title: Study Effects Antidepressant Medication Placebo Brain Functioning Normal Subjects
DOC.criteria: Subject age 1875 year Subject must overall good health ( i.e. , free medical condition know affect brain function ) . Subject must participate former study , Physiologic Monitoring Antidepressant Medication Effects Normal Controls Subjects ( IRB # : 001103813 ) Subject normal physical exam within one year prior entry study Capacity give Informed Consent Subject serious medical illness , high blood pressure , heart disease , renal impairment , cirrhosis liver . Subject meet DSMIV Axis I criteria mood , anxiety , cognitive , psychiatric disorder ; meet criteria cluster A B axis II diagnose . These disorder determine basis structure assessment MINI ( Mini International Neuropsychiatric Interview DSMIV Axis I Disorders ) Subject history current past active suicidal ideation suicide attempt . Subject receive treatment antidepressant medication medication could influence brain function since his/her participation initial study Subject use follow medication interfere EEG measure brain function : Anticholinergics , Barbiturates , Benzodiazepines , Sedating Antihistamines ( e.g . diphenhydramine ( Benadryl ) would exclusionary , loratadine ( Claritin ) ) Subject history seizure , brain surgery , skull fracture , significant head trauma , previous abnormal EEG Subject pregnant planning become pregnancy course study Subject UCLA student staff member directly instruction employment investigator
